major_topics.title: Evangelism and Witnessing
major_topics.description: Examples of how God's Spirit empowers believers to boldly share the gospel and lead others to faith.

categories.category_description: God's Spirit fills His people with courage and boldness to proclaim the gospel fearlessly.

scriptures.text: But you will receive power when the Holy Spirit has come upon you, and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the end of the earth.
scriptures.context_description: Jesus promises the disciples spiritual power to carry the gospel from their city to the ends of the earth.

scriptures.text: And when they had prayed, the place in which they were gathered together was shaken, and they were all filled with the Holy Spirit and continued to speak the word of God with boldness.
scriptures.context_description: After facing threats, the early Christians pray and are refilled with the Holy Spirit, enabling them to preach God’s word boldly despite opposition.

scriptures.text: for God gave us a spirit not of fear but of power and love and self-control.
scriptures.context_description: Paul reminds Timothy that the Spirit God gave believers emboldens them with power, love, and discipline, dispelling timidity in ministry.

categories.category_description: The Holy Spirit guides and empowers the spread of the gospel through preaching, miracles, and conviction.

scriptures.text: because our gospel came to you not only in word, but also in power and in the Holy Spirit and with full conviction. You know what kind of men we proved to be among you for your sake.
scriptures.context_description: Paul notes that his message in Thessalonica was effective because it came with Holy Spirit power and deep conviction, not just words.

scriptures.text: It was revealed to them that they were serving not themselves but you, in the things that have now been announced to you through those who preached the good news to you by the Holy Spirit sent from heaven...
scriptures.context_description: Peter explains that the gospel news was delivered to his readers by preachers empowered by the Holy Spirit from heaven.

scriptures.text: For I will not venture to speak of anything except what Christ has accomplished through me to bring the Gentiles to obedience—by word and deed, by the power of signs and wonders, by the power of the Spirit of God...
scriptures.context_description: Paul attributes his fruitful mission among the Gentiles to Christ’s work through him by the power of the Holy Spirit, including miraculous signs.

scriptures.text: and my speech and my message were not in plausible words of wisdom, but in demonstration of the Spirit and of power, so that your faith might not rest in the wisdom of men but in the power of God.
scriptures.context_description: Paul reminds the Corinthians that his preaching relied on the Holy Spirit’s power rather than human eloquence, so that their faith would be founded on God’s power.

major_topics.title: Leadership and Courage
major_topics.description: Spirit-filled leadership in Scripture, where God’s Spirit equips judges, kings, and elders with strength, wisdom, and courage to lead His people.

categories.category_description: In times of crisis, the Spirit of the Lord empowered judges and leaders with might and courage to deliver Israel.

scriptures.text: The Spirit of the LORD was upon him, and he judged Israel. He went out to war, and the LORD gave Cushan-rishathaim king of Mesopotamia into his hand. And his hand prevailed over Cushan-rishathaim.
scriptures.context_description: Othniel, one of the judges, was filled with God’s Spirit to lead Israel to victory in battle against their oppressor.

scriptures.text: But the Spirit of the LORD clothed Gideon, and he sounded the trumpet, and the Abiezrites were called out to follow him.
scriptures.context_description: God’s Spirit empowered Gideon to rally Israel’s tribes and lead them, giving him the courage to confront the Midianites.

scriptures.text: Then the Spirit of the LORD rushed upon him, and the ropes that were on his arms became as flax that has caught fire, and his bonds melted off his hands. And he found a fresh jawbone of a donkey... and with it he struck 1,000 men.
scriptures.context_description: When Samson was bound by enemies, the Spirit of God came powerfully on him, enabling a miraculous burst of strength to defeat a thousand Philistines.

scriptures.text: And the Spirit of God rushed upon Saul when he heard these words, and his anger was greatly kindled.
scriptures.context_description: Upon hearing of Israel’s plight, King Saul was filled with God’s Spirit, which stirred him to righteous anger and action to save the besieged city of Jabesh.

categories.category_description: God’s Spirit provides wisdom, authority, and boldness to those called to lead and speak for Him, from elders and kings to prophets and pastors.

scriptures.text: Then the LORD came down in the cloud and spoke to him, and took some of the Spirit that was on him and put it on the seventy elders. And as soon as the Spirit rested on them, they prophesied. But they did not continue doing it.
scriptures.context_description: God shares the Spirit that was on Moses with seventy elders of Israel, equipping them to help bear the leadership burden (evidenced by a one-time prophetic sign).

scriptures.text: And Joshua the son of Nun was full of the spirit of wisdom, for Moses had laid his hands on him. So the people of Israel obeyed him and did as the LORD had commanded Moses.
scriptures.context_description: Joshua is filled with the Spirit-given wisdom as Moses’ successor, enabling him to lead Israel faithfully and continue Moses’ work.

scriptures.text: Then Samuel took the horn of oil and anointed him in the midst of his brothers. And the Spirit of the LORD rushed upon David from that day forward.
scriptures.context_description: When David is anointed as future king, God’s Spirit comes mightily upon him, marking the start of his empowered leadership over Israel.

scriptures.text: But as for me, I am filled with power, with the Spirit of the LORD, and with justice and might, to declare to Jacob his transgression and to Israel his sin.
scriptures.context_description: The prophet Micah testifies that the Spirit of the Lord empowers him with courage and moral strength to confront Israel’s sins with bold preaching.

scriptures.text: Pay careful attention to yourselves and to all the flock, in which the Holy Spirit has made you overseers, to care for the church of God, which he obtained with his own blood.
scriptures.context_description: Paul reminds the Ephesian elders that the Holy Spirit Himself appointed them as overseers (pastors) to shepherd the church, emphasizing that their leadership role is empowered and authorized by God’s Spirit.

major_topics.title: Service and Good Works
major_topics.description: Believers serve God energetically, using gifts and strength supplied by the Holy Spirit to accomplish good works for God’s glory.

categories.category_description: The Bible calls us to zeal and diligence in serving God, fueled by His grace rather than laziness or apathy.

scriptures.text: Do not be slothful in zeal, be fervent in spirit, serve the Lord.
scriptures.context_description: Christians are exhorted to serve the Lord enthusiastically—maintaining spiritual fervor instead of laziness.

scriptures.text: But by the grace of God I am what I am, and his grace toward me was not in vain. On the contrary, I worked harder than any of them, though it was not I, but the grace of God that is with me.
scriptures.context_description: Paul acknowledges that he labored strenuously in ministry, yet he credits God’s grace working through him for all his hard work, rather than his own strength.

categories.category_description: Rather than relying on human ability alone, God’s people are empowered by His Spirit to do the work He calls them to do—whether creative, practical, or spiritual service.

scriptures.text: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, with ability and intelligence, with knowledge and all craftsmanship,
scriptures.context_description: God fills Bezalel with His Spirit to skillfully craft the tabernacle items, showing that even artistic and practical tasks for God can be Spirit-empowered.

scriptures.text: "Work, for I am with you, declares the LORD of hosts... My Spirit remains in your midst. Fear not."
scriptures.context_description: Through Haggai, God encourages the remnant rebuilding the temple to take courage and work hard, because His Spirit is among them strengthening them, so they need not fear.

scriptures.text: for it is God who works in you, both to will and to work for his good pleasure.
scriptures.context_description: Believers can persevere in good works knowing that God Himself is at work inside them, giving them the desire and ability to do what pleases Him.

scriptures.text: whoever serves, as one who serves by the strength that God supplies— in order that in everything God may be glorified through Jesus Christ.
scriptures.context_description: Peter instructs that anyone serving in the church should do so relying on the strength God provides, so that God (not the servant) gets the glory in everything.

scriptures.text: For this I toil, struggling with all his energy that he powerfully works within me.
scriptures.context_description: Paul describes how he toils in ministry using Christ’s energy working powerfully through him, indicating that his intense labor is enabled by God’s power.

major_topics.title: Perseverance and Endurance
major_topics.description: Scripture emphasizes that enduring in faith and ministry is made possible by God’s Spirit supplying strength, especially in times of weakness or opposition.

categories.category_description: God strengthens His people from within by His Spirit so they can endure trials and continue doing His will.

scriptures.text: that according to the riches of his glory he may grant you to be strengthened with power through his Spirit in your inner being,
scriptures.context_description: Paul prays for believers to be fortified with spiritual power by the Holy Spirit deep inside them, enabling them to stand firm and carry on.

scriptures.text: being strengthened with all power, according to his glorious might, for all endurance and patience with joy;
scriptures.context_description: Christians are strengthened by God’s glorious might, receiving all the power they need to endure difficult circumstances with patience and even joy.

scriptures.text: Then he said to me, "This is the word of the LORD to Zerubbabel: Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit, says the LORD of hosts."
scriptures.context_description: Through Zechariah, God assures Zerubbabel (who was tasked with rebuilding the temple) that the work will be accomplished not by human strength but by the Holy Spirit’s power.

categories.category_description: In hardships and human weakness, God’s power through the Holy Spirit sustains believers, showing that perseverance comes from His strength, not our own.

scriptures.text: But we have this treasure in jars of clay, to show that the surpassing power belongs to God and not to us. We are afflicted in every way, but not crushed; perplexed, but not driven to despair; persecuted, but not forsaken; struck down, but not destroyed;
scriptures.context_description: Paul describes himself as a fragile "jar of clay" carrying the treasure of the gospel, to show that the sustaining power through many hardships comes from God, not from Paul.

scriptures.text: But he said to me, "My grace is sufficient for you, for My power is made perfect in weakness." Therefore I will boast all the more gladly of my weaknesses, so that the power of Christ may rest upon me... For when I am weak, then I am strong.
scriptures.context_description: God tells Paul that divine strength is perfected in our weakness. Paul accepts his own limitations and trials, because they allow Christ’s power (through the Spirit) to work in him and make him truly strong.
